afterCommit.message:
chore(engine): use connect to sent telemetry requests

* add connect dependency to engine
* fix typo in telemetry logger
* add connect to wildfly distro

Related to CAM-12158

nodes.bodyText: Instead of hard coded value 202  you can use java.net.HttpURLConnection.HTTP_ACCEPTED.
The variable name is not great. telemetryHttpConnector would better describe the object.
Not directly related to this change: We shoud log some details here, e.g. response code so that debugging is easier.
Or alternatively use our own constant. Same for the tests.
Why do some of the tests use Mockito instead of making a request against Wiremock like the others?

* fix typo in telemetry logger

Related to CAM-12158

commit.message:
chore(engine): use connect to sent telemetry requests

* load connectors in ejb platform bootstrap for wls/was
* try to initialize the connector when sending if it was not during
engine start
* improve logging
* fix telemetry tests
* add telemetry logger to logback-test.xml

afterCommit.message:
chore(engine): use connect to sent telemetry requests

* load connectors in ejb platform bootstrap for wls/was
* try to initialize the connector when sending if it was not during
engine start
* improve logging
* fix telemetry tests
* add telemetry logger to logback-test.xml

nodes.bodyText: I think we can log this message on a higher level, e.g. warning. It is only logged once on engine start and relevant to understand if telemetry works at all. For the message, maybe something like No http connector found. No telemetry data will be sent. is a little clearer for people reading the logs.
I think this adds no benefit. Connectors#getConnector already initializes the connectors if they are not loaded yet.
There's a typo in the method name.
This should be a class rule to avoid building a new engine with every test.
Does this actually work? It loads the connectors with the classloader of Connectors.class which would be the shared lib classloader in the case of WLS and WAS, right?

commit.message:
improve(engine): improve connectors initialization

* improve telemetry tests and logging
* start reporter only if the http connector is initialized
add connect plugin in ejb service
start reporter only if the httpConnector is set
use wildfly subsystem classloader to load the connectors

nodes.bodyText: This should happen in an @After method

nodes.bodyText: Is this import still needed when the connectors are initialized in the subsystem?
This change must also be made in the Wildfly subsystem, right?
Please set to private or protected.
